name: B. Sorted Adjacent Differences
statement:
You have array of n numbers a_{1}, a_{2},
ldots, a_{n}. Rearrange these numbers to satisfy |a_{1} - a_{2}|
le |a_{2} - a_{3}|
le
ldots
le |a_{n-1} - a_{n}|, where |x| denotes absolute value of x. It’s always
possible to find such rearrangement.Note that all numbers in a are not
necessarily different. In other words, some numbers of a may be same.You
have to answer independent t test cases.
